reviewText: Daughter loved it

I purchased this to go along with Shimmer and Shine dolls and dress-up outfit. My granddaughters love Shimmer and Shine and have designated with one of them is Shimmer and which one is Shine. They watch movies over and over and this will be a great element in their themed Shimmer and Shine Christmas present. I have seem the movie and so have they, and it is so cute and appropriate for a 5 and 6 year old.
GRANDDAUGHTER VERY HAPPY.
Just wish the second season was more like the first one.

This is another one of my granddaughter's Christmas presents so she has not received it yet.  However, she loves the Shimmer and Shine cartoon.  I bought her a Shimmer and Shine backpack which she loves.

This show was much cuter with better lessons in the first season as they visited Leah in the real world. Now, in the second season, they have introduced a villain and are in the genie world. Less focus on learning from mistakes and more genie shenanigans. They also switched to cgi and the animation isn't nearly as charming as it was before. Very disappointed.
Gift for granddaughter and she loved it.

This is an adorable DVD featuring Shimmer and Shine in three magical episodes. These are episodes that have previously aired on television but perfect to be able to watch Shimmer and Shine whenever your child wants. We actually always seem to miss the show live so we had never seen these three episodes. My 5 year old daughter loves this show and I admit I don't mind watching it either. The show is wholesome and so full of colors and fun characters. These episodes are all about the problems the girls solve, friendship and teamwork.

Shimmer and Shine: Welcome to Zahramay Falls includes the following episodes:

Welcome to Zahramay Falls - Shimmer and Shine receive a special Green Burst Gem from Princess Samira and bring it into the human world. The evil sorceress Zeta uses magic to steal the gem, but her spell goes awry and pulls Leah and Zac into Zahramay Falls.

First Wish (Double Episode) - Leah wins a genie bottle pendant at a carnival and is surprised to find that her prize comes with a bonus - Shimmer and Shine.  Leah wishes for a polka-dotted elephant and things get complicated when Leah uses her remaining wishes to keep Zac from seeing the elephant. In the end, the girls create a new carnival attraction and learn that they can overcome any obstacle by working together.

Happy Wishaversary - It's time for Shimmer, Shine and Leah to celebrate their Wishaversary! In honor of their Wishaversary, Shimmer and Shine make Leah the perfect gift-a bracelet with a magical touch. When Leah puts the bracelet on, she can float like a genie. However, when Zac shows up to play a video game with Leah, Rocket gets a hold of the bracelet and starts to float. Leah must play the video game with Zac, while also working with the genies to retrieve the magical bracelet before Zac sees Rocket floating away.

I received this DVD to review in exchange for sharing my honest opinion.

THE DVD HAS 1 DOUBLE-LENGTH EPISODE AND 2 EPISODES:
SHIMMER AND SHINE EPISODE 1: THE FIRST WISH PART 1,
SHIMMER AND SHINE EPISODE 2: THE FIRST WISH PART 2,
SHIMMER AND SHINE EPISODE 20: HAPPY WISHAVERSARY
AND
SHIMMER AND SHINE EPISODE 21: WELCOME TO ZAHRAMAY FALLS
love it
Just as described.

The show itself is great and my 4 year old daughter loves shimmer and shine. I can only give this DVD 2 stars because it only has 3 episodes, where most have 6 or so. This DVD includes:
1. Welcome to Zahramay Falls
2. First wish
3. Wishaversary

Doesn't fit exactly, not very good protection, the lip on top is so miniscule that if it fell, I'm sure my phone screen would crack. It is pretty, much more gray in person. 2 stars bc it is pretty and if you only want for the look, and no protection, it would be good for that.
Wonderful quality! My daughter loves it.
I forgot to pack my daughters DVD in her bag when she was returning to her moms house. This set literally saved a dad from a disaster. Everything arrived quickly in perfect condition. Thanks!
She loved it!
Great DVD to keep the kids quiet in the car.

My daughter loves this but there is only 3 episodes the other two dvds have more.  I would get those first. Still a safe choice for little kids to watch, no traumatic dramatic plot twists like a disney movie.  Not super educational though.
For my granddaughter when she visited my home in California.  She loved it.
